channel.title: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail
channel.description: alright first off here what you will need: ------supplies------ 1. Your Letter 2. An Envolope -------------------- ok all you have to do is put your name as the reciver of the letter and the person you are sending the letter to as the sender ^.^ now give it to a local post office and they will see that there is no stamp! so they will return it to the sender sometimes...works at a 50/50 chance.

item.title: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail
item.dc:creator: @Shef231 Shef231
item.description:
@Shef231 wrote:

This isn’t clever at all, because it just won’t work. You take a letter to the post office with no stamp and then expect it to get to the intended person for free? That will not work. Why would someone from all over the other side of the city or a different city go to that specific post office to send a letter, when there are probably another 10 closer to them?

You may reply with “It would work if you’re to send a letter to someone closeby.” But why would you even want to send a letter to someone closeby? Just walk your lazy ass over there and post it yourself. Or simply talk to the person face to face!

Read full topic
item.source: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail

item.title: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

But they still stamp the zip-code that you sent it from. If the return address != stamped zip-code, they’ll just read it, make fun of it, and toss it. And who cares? Just email it…jeez.

Read full topic
item.source: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail

item.title: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

xxlegitxx:

I thought about this when I was like 7. I came to the conclusion that they stamp your mail with your zip code. So if the receiver has a different zip code, then you’re fucked. In addition, the mailman is not a dumbass, so he would know that a) you have no stamp. b) your return address is not your home address. c) you don’t have a mailing address.

True, but you never know what kind of mailman you’re dealing with…He could just be that one of a kind dumba*s

Read full topic
item.source: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail

item.title: How To Send A Free Letter By Mail
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

irfan786:

It actually won’t work. The post office checks for this stuff.

If you think about it, it should work…I mean, what do they have to check? As long as the person isn’t like 100 miles away…They would have to be in the same post office area for it to work(why would someones letter from 100 miles away turn up in there office? You know what I mean?)
